basics.name: Zhaojin Chu (褚昭锦)
basics.label: ECE Student & Builder
basics.summary: Electrical & Computer Engineering student at Carnegie Mellon who learns best by building—most at home where hardware meets software (embedded systems, digital design, applied ML). Founder of Logic Labs; open to project, research, and internship collaborations.

work.name: Logic Labs
work.summary: Created hands-on electronics kits and delivered lectures/workshops to 60+ students; built a Node.js/React e-commerce stack with Stripe; led a small team, coordinated kit roadmaps, and incorporated student feedback.
highlights: Launched full-stack storefront with secure Stripe checkout
Designed kit curriculum and teaching materials
Ran campus workshops and gathered structured feedback

work.name: Cobblestone Energy
work.summary: Built a UK-wide, weather-driven day-ahead forecast using lags/rolling stats and walk-forward cross-validation to inform trading strategies.

volunteer.summary: Supported daily operations and community events.
Assisted with animal care at a local shelter.

volunteer.organization: Computer Science Academic Enrichment & Top University Preparation (TopUP), Dubai College
volunteer.summary: Co-created computer lab resources; taught enrichment sessions for advanced CS students.

education.score: A-Levels: 4A* (Maths, Further Maths, Physics, Computer Science); ACT 35/36; GCSEs: 9×9, 2×8

awards.title: Netcraft Computer Science Prize — Top 100 Global
Pearson High Achiever — Certificate of Excellence (GCSEs)
Intermediate British Physics Olympiad — Gold Award
12th International Music Competition “Città degli Imperiali” — 1st Prize (Piano)

certificates.name: AI for Everyone: Master the Basics

publications.name: Impact and Perception of Generative AI and Related Automation Tools in the Gulf Region
publications.publisher: The Political Economy of the Middle East
publications.summary: Survey-based study (500+ respondents) analyzed with Structural Equation Modeling; presented at the Gulf Research Meeting (Cambridge University).

projects.name: License Plate Recognition (LPR) Model
projects.summary: CNN-based license-plate detector for Dubai plates; deployment-path via ONNX with potential quantization.
highlights: Custom dataset of 500+ labeled plates with augmentation
Training & evaluation in PyTorch (tracking mAP/F1, latency)
Explored model families: EfficientNet, MobileNetV3, ResNet18/50

projects.name: MusBook
projects.summary: Scheduling platform for music lessons with real-time messaging and role-based dashboards.

projects.name: Perception of Generative AI in the Gulf
projects.summary: Large-N survey with SEM exploring attitudes toward generative AI and automation.
highlights: Presented at Cambridge; publication in a regional political-economy volume

projects.name: Evaluating NPUs vs. Traditional Processors
projects.summary: Benchmarks and analysis of inference performance/efficiency and bandwidth constraints; 6k-word thesis.

projects.name: Computer Lab Co-Creation (Dubai College)
projects.summary: Spearheaded building the school’s computer lab and component kits; mentored younger students.
highlights: Guided lesson plans and hands-on labs

affiliations.name: National Youth Orchestra of Dubai
affiliations.summary: Section leadership and performances, including major venues.

affiliations.name: Dubai College Symphony Orchestra
affiliations.summary: Regular ensemble performances and mentoring younger players.

affiliations.name: Dubai Computing Community
affiliations.summary: Community outreach and event promotion for local computing meetups.

other.summary: Composed soundtrack for an Expo 2020 Dubai installation.
